intro: Obione argentina, commonly known as the Argentine obione, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in temperate climates. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
